channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Some Maryland parents want the Supreme Court to let them pull their kids from elementary school classes if story time features gay characters
item.description: Montgomery County public schools introduced the storybooks as part of an effort to better reflect the district's diverse population.

item.title: IMF Expects Trump’s Tariffs Will Slow Global Economic Growth
item.description: The International Monetary Fund expects slower growth and higher inflation in the U.S. as a result of President Trump’s trade policies.

item.title: ESPN host Shannon Sharpe will continue his on-air duties despite getting hit with $50 million lawsuit accusing him of rape
item.description: Sharpe is accused of verbal abuse, violence, making threats, and recording sexual encounters without consent.

item.title: Greenland Navigates the New World Order
item.description: Whom Greenlanders choose to do business with — economically, politically and socially — will tell us a lot about the coming global realignment.

item.title: U.S. Bank shares tribute on earnings call to executive Terry Dolan who died in Minnesota plane crash
item.description: Dolan was remembered as an "outstanding businessman and wonderful person."

item.title: Tesla’s Falling Profit May Pressure Elon Musk to Return to Day Job
item.description: The carmaker is expected to report a decline in quarterly earnings after Tesla’s brand suffered because of its chief executive’s role in the Trump adm...

item.title: Uber is launching a shuttle bus service at the Atlanta airport
item.description: Expansion follows successful roll-out in NYC.

item.title: Can Harvard Withstand Trump’s Financial Attack?
item.description: The world’s richest university may have enough money to survive a battle with the most powerful man in the world. But if Trump wins, Harvard won’t be ...

item.title: Russia and Ukraine, Under Trump Pressure, Signal Openness to Direct Talks
item.description: An unusual public back-and-forth suggested that both sides in the war were eager to at least appear interested in negotiations.

item.title: As Big Oil producers start exploring again, the Gulf of Mexico is making a comeback with new projects from Chevron, Shell and BP
item.description: New technologies and cost savings are unlocking Big Oil projects in the Gulf

item.title: IMF Expects Trump’s Tariffs Will Slow Global Economic Growth
item.description: The International Monetary Fund expects slower growth and higher inflation in the U.S. as a result of President Trump’s trade policies.

item.title: Even in Sickness, Pope Francis Reached Out to Gaza’s Christians
item.description: For months, the pontiff spoke by telephone almost every night with people sheltering in a Catholic church in the battered enclave, a ritual he tried t...

item.title: ‘Francis Was Deeply Loved’: Gazans Mourn Death of Pope
item.description: Gaza’s Christians paid their respects to Pope Francis, who called in on a local church almost daily to check on them throughout the war.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine, Under Trump Pressure, Signal Openness to Direct Talks
item.description: An unusual public back-and-forth suggested that both sides in the war were eager to at least appear interested in negotiations.

item.title: Latest Updates: Vatican to Hold Pope’s Funeral on Saturday
item.description: Pope Francis’ funeral will be a more modest event, after the pontiff broke with longstanding Vatican tradition to simplify the ritual. It will most li...
